poem:
### California's Core

Ethnic hues in sunlit rooms,  
a tapestry woven on classroom looms.  
Children shake the roots of time,  
in whispers of lineage and rhyme.  
Yet sunlight's shimmer fades to night,  
unwrapped by shadows in quiet plight.  
The song of progress, a fleeting note—  
etched on hearts, but adrift afloat.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
